Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
This class represents a Portfolio that will manage stocks and mutualfunds

  • Constructor Details

    • Portfolio

      public Portfolio()
      This Constructor for new Portfolio object This initializes investments arraylist and nameindex arraylist for the hashmap

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method is the entry point for my program. It initializes a new Portfolio and a Scanner for user input.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments passed to the program

    • buyInvestment

      public void buyInvestment(String investmentChoice, String investmentSymbol, String name, int quantity, double price) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Buys an investment (Stock or MutualFund) and adds it to the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      investmentChoice - the type of investment, either "stock" or "mutualfund"
      investmentSymbol - the unique symbol identifying the investment
      name - the name of the investment
      quantity - the number of investment units to purchase
      price - the price per unit of the investment
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input parameters are invalid or if an investment with the same symbol already exists

    • sellInvestment

      public void sellInvestment(String investmentSymbol, int quantity, double price) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sells a specified quantity of an investment from the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      investmentSymbol - the symbol of the investment to sell
      quantity - the number of units to sell
      price - the selling price per unit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the quantity or price is invalid

    • getInvestments

      public ArrayList<Investment> getInvestments()
      Array list for getting the investments
      Returns:
      this returns an investments array list

    • updateInvestmentPrice

      public void updateInvestmentPrice(int index, double newPrice)
      Updates the price of an investment at the specified index in the portfolio. Recalculates the book value after updating the price.
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the investment in the investments list
      newPrice - the updated price for the investment

    • getTotalGain

      public double getTotalGain()
      Calculates and returns the total gain across all investments in the portfolio.
      Returns:
      the total financial gain of all investments, combining gains from both stocks and mutual funds

    • getIndividualGains

      public String getIndividualGains()
      Generates a formatted string of individual gains for each investment.
      Returns:
      a string containing the name, symbol, and gain for each investment, with each investment on a new line

    • searchInvestments

      public String searchInvestments(String symbolInput, String keywordSearch, double lowPrice, double highPrice)
      Searches for investments based on specified search criteria.
      Parameters:
      symbolInput - the investment symbol to filter by (case-insensitive)
      keywordSearch - keywords to match against investment names
      lowPrice - the lower bound of the price range to search
      highPrice - the upper bound of the price range to search
      Returns:
      a string containing details of matching investments, or a message if no investments are found
